FileFormat.FormatDescription: The Memory Stick Voice (MSV) format is an audio file format that was used on the Sony Memory Stick IC recorder, specifically the ICD-MS1 model. Two versions of the MSV format exist: MSV (ADPCM) and MSV (LPEC). The first version, this one, MSV (ADPCM), uses an unspecified type of ADPCM compression, while MSV (LPEC) uses Sony's proprietary Long-term Predicted Excitation Coding (LPEC) codec.
FileFormat.ProvenanceName: Brigham Young University / Brigham Young University

InternalSignature.SignatureNote: Description:'MS_VOICE' followed by 00x01000000'SONY CORPORATION' and then after 28 bytes the following sequence 00x00(05|09)0001

RelatedFormat.RelatedFormatName: Sony Digital Voice File/Sony Memory Stick Voice File
